title: Sound Track Recordings from the Film Jimi Hendrix (WEA-Reprise,
description:
Upon request.
I'll be seeding this only until 05.00 PM of June 29th 2009
(Central European Time).

Jimi Hendrix

"Sound Track Recordings from the Film Jimi Hendrix"
[WEA - Reprise 64017 (2 RS 6481) Cx2, France, 1973, 2LP]

- Transfer of the French Reprise edition of the long OOP double vinyl album.
- Transferred by Emilovius

- Lineage:
Original LPs ->
Lenco L78 (ATC eliptical) -> 
Pre-amp Multicurve Professional (F&C Electronic) ->
AD Converter (Finalazer 96K plus) -> 
PC ->
Samplitude V8.31 (track editing, click removal) ->
Sound Forge Audio Studio -> 
WAV ->
APE

- Arranged simple artwork included (arr. by E).

Note by E:
This is a new transfer. Made from the VG+
old vinyl from my collection. Not as good as those
of Prof. Stoned but still a fine sounding transfer
in stereo and all frequencies clearly present.
No EQ or noise reduction. Only manual and
automatic click removal tools were applied.

Track List
Disc 1:
Side A
01. Rock Me, Baby 
Monterey International Pop Festival, 1967-06-18 
02. Wild Thing 
Monterey International Pop Festival, 1967-06-18 
NOTE: Feedback guitar introduction has been edited out 
03. Machine Gun I
Isle of Wight Festival, 1970-08-30 
NOTE: fragment - only 7:45 out of originally 22 minutes long concert jam 
04. Interviews I 
Freddie Mae Gautier, Dolores Hall, Jimi, Al Hendrix
Side B
05. Johnny B. Goode 
Berkeley Community Theatre, Berkeley, California, 1970-05-30, 1st show
06. Hey Joe 
Monterey International Pop Festival, 1967-06-18 
07. Purple Haze 
Berkeley Community Theatre, Berkeley, California, 1970-05-30, 1st show
08. Like a Rolling Stone 
Monterey International Pop Festival, 1967-06-18 
09. Interviews II 
Jimi, Little Richard, Pat Hartley, Jimi, Fayne Pridgon 

Disc 2:
Side C
01. The Star Spangled Banner
Woodstock 1969-08-18 
02. Machine Gun II
Fillmore East, New York City, 1970-01-01, 1st show 
03. Getting My Heart Back Together Again
Bruce Fleming's Photo Studio, 12 Great Newport Street, 
London, WC2, England, 1967-12-19 
04. Interviews III 
Fayne Pridgon, Jimi, Paul Caruso 
Side D
05. Red House 
Isle of Wight Festival, 1970-08-30 
06. In From the Storm 
Isle of Wight Festival, 1970-08-30 
07. Interviews IV 
Pat Hartley, The "Ghetto Fighters," Alan Douglas, Fayne Pridgon 

June 2009.
